title: Zhang Gan
text: Zhang Gan () (17 September 1897 – 21 February 1959) was a <a href="Kuomintang">Kuomintang</a> general from Guangxi. Originally a <a href="major">major</a> in the army of Lu Rongting's <a href="Old%20Guangxi%20clique">Old Guangxi clique</a>, he went to over to <a href="Li%20Zongren">Li Zongren</a>'s <a href="New%20Guangxi%20clique">New Guangxi clique</a> in 1926 and was subsequently promoted to <a href="Lieutenant%20Colonel">Lieutenant Colonel</a> and then <a href="Colonel">Colonel</a>. In 1938, he participated in the defense of <a href="Wuhan">Wuhan</a>. In 1939, after his participation in defending the northern <a href="Hubei">Hubei</a> city of <a href="Zaoyang">Zaoyang</a> against the attacks of the <a href="Imperial%20Japanese%20Army">Imperial Japanese Army</a> commanded by <a href="Yasuji%20Okamura">Yasuji Okamura</a>. On 30 November 1949, he was taken prisoner by the <a href="Chinese%20Communist%20Party">Chinese Communist Party</a>'s <a href="People%27s%20Liberation%20Army">People's Liberation Army</a>, 10 years later he died in prison (1959-02-21).
